TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi abstract beforefieldinit ScriptObject extends System.Object implements class System.Reflection.IReflect

Docs.summary: Supports all JScript classes. This is the ultimate base class of all JScript classes. This class belongs to the objects and functions category.

MemberSignature.Value: public Microsoft.JScript.Vsa.VsaEngine engine;
.field public class Microsoft.JScript.Vsa.VsaEngine engine

MemberSignature.Value: public Microsoft.JScript.ScriptObject GetParent ();
.method public hidebysig instance class Microsoft.JScript.ScriptObject GetParent() cil managed

Docs.summary: Gets a reference to the parent object.
Docs.returns: A reference to the parent object.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The parent is the object to which the script object delegates requests for properties or methods that it does not implement itself. For example, when you create a <xref:Microsoft.JScript.NumberObject> by using a <xref:Microsoft.JScript.NumberConstructor>, the parent is a <xref:Microsoft.JScript.NumberPrototype>.

Docs.param: The name of the property to search for.
A bitwise combination of the enumeration values that specifies how the search for members is conducted by reflection.
An object that performs type conversion from actual argument type to formal argument type.
The type of the return value that the property must have.
The index types of the property being searched for. Used for index properties, such as the indexer for a class.
An array of parameter modifiers that enable binding to work with parameter signatures in which the types have been modified.

Docs.returns: A property that has the specified , or null if the script object does not contain the property.

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual object InvokeMember (string name, System.Reflection.BindingFlags invokeAttr, System.Reflection.Binder binder, object target, object[] args, System.Reflection.ParameterModifier[] modifiers, System.Globalization.CultureInfo locale, string[] namedParameters);

.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance object InvokeMember(string name, valuetype System.Reflection.BindingFlags invokeAttr, class System.Reflection.Binder binder, object target, object[] args, valuetype System.Reflection.ParameterModifier[] modifiers, class System.Globalization.CultureInfo locale, string[] namedParameters) cil managed

Docs.param: The name of the member to invoke.
A bitwise combination of the enumeration values that specifies how the search for members is conducted by reflection.
An object that performs type conversion from actual argument type to formal argument type.
The object on which to invoke the member. This must be the current script object.
An array of objects that contains the number, order, and type of the parameters of the member to be invoked. This is an empty array if there are no parameters.
An array that has the same length as the args parameter. It represents the invoked member's argument attributes in the metadata.
Provides information about a specific culture or locale. Used to format numbers, dates, and strings correctly.
An array of parameters.
Docs.summary: Invokes the specified member.
Docs.returns: The return value of the call to the member.

remarks.format: ## Remarks If the `pars` array has more than one element, the last element is the argument for this property.

MemberSignature.Value: protected Microsoft.JScript.ScriptObject parent;
.field family class Microsoft.JScript.ScriptObject parent

Docs.summary: Stores a reference to the parent object.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The parent is the object to which the script object delegates requests for properties or methods that it does not implement itself. For example, when you create a <xref:Microsoft.JScript.NumberObject> by using a <xref:Microsoft.JScript.NumberConstructor>, the parent is a <xref:Microsoft.JScript.NumberPrototype>.

MemberSignature.Value: protected static System.Reflection.MemberInfo[] WrapMembers (System.Reflection.MemberInfo member, object obj);
.method familystatic hidebysig class System.Reflection.MemberInfo[] WrapMembers(class System.Reflection.MemberInfo member, object obj) cil managed

Docs.param: The member to wrap.
The object that `member` is defined on.
Docs.summary: Creates a wrapped object that contains the specified member together with the specified object.
Docs.returns: A one-element array that has a wrapped object that contains the member information and .

remarks.format: ## Remarks This method enables other objects that do not contain the member to store it and then return its value as if it were their own.

MemberSignature.Value: protected static System.Reflection.MemberInfo[] WrapMembers (System.Reflection.MemberInfo[] members, object obj);
.method familystatic hidebysig class System.Reflection.MemberInfo[] WrapMembers(class System.Reflection.MemberInfo[] members, object obj) cil managed

Docs.param: The members to wrap.
The object that `members` are defined on.
Docs.summary: Creates an array of wrapped objects that contain the specified members together with the specified object.
Docs.returns: An array of wrapped objects, each of which contains member information and a copy of .

remarks.format: ## Remarks This method enables other objects that do not contain these members to store them and then return their values as if they were their own.

MemberSignature.Value: protected static System.Reflection.MemberInfo[] WrapMembers (System.Reflection.MemberInfo[] members, object obj, Microsoft.JScript.SimpleHashtable cache);
.method familystatic hidebysig class System.Reflection.MemberInfo[] WrapMembers(class System.Reflection.MemberInfo[] members, object obj, class Microsoft.JScript.SimpleHashtable cache) cil managed

Docs.param: The members to wrap.
The object that `members` are defined on.
Temporary data storage for the wrapped objects.
Docs.summary: Creates an array of wrapped objects that contain the specified members together with the specified object, caching the results in the specified data storage.
Docs.returns: An array of wrapped objects, each of which contains member information and a copy of .

remarks.format: ## Remarks This method enables other objects that do not contain these members to store them and then return their values as if they were their own.
